title: 20 Deals from Amazon’s Massive End-of-Year Sale Event You Won't Want to Miss
description: It's your last chance to save big on the kitchen splurge you've been eyeing! READ MORE...
author: Sarah M. Vazquez
excerpt: It's your last chance to save big on the kitchen splurge you've been eyeing!
text: Kitchen & HomeLife In The KitchenSarah M. VazquezCommerce SEO EditorFor the past 8 years, I've covered all things shopping. My work's been published by Hearst, PureWow, and Bauer Media Group. I'm a Brooklyn-born Jersey Girl (with a BA in English from Montclair State University) who loves a good playlist, a good bagel, and my family (but not necessarily in that order).published about 4 hours agoWe independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.Credit: Marina Andrejchenko/ShutterstockHot take: My favorite time of the year to shop is after Christmas. Now, you might be saying to yourself, “But, what about Prime Day? Memorial Day? BLACK FRIDAY?” Yes, these sales are also great times to save big, but end-of-year sales just hit different. The discounts are still major, and once the holidays have passed, prices can drop even lower (something that makes me more than excited to whip out my shiny new gift cards). And one place I’ll always scour is Amazon. The Best Amazon End-of-Year Deals When it comes to end-of-year deals, it’s hard to top Amazon. The retail giant quite literally has it all, and thanks to its end-of-year sale, a great deal on everything from the piece of tech you’ve been eyeing to a coveted piece of cookware is practically a given. Don’t believe me? Below, I rounded up 20 of the best Amazon end-of-year deals you won’t want to miss, including a host of editor- and reader-favorites that are guaranteed to have you start off 2025 with a bang. 1 / 20Amazon$169.99was $199.99If there’s one countertop appliance that was on everyone’s wish list this year, it was the Ninja CREAMi — and if you haven’t gotten your hands on one, now’s the time. Instead of having to run to the store every time you’re in the mood for ice cream, you can use this machine and the ingredients that are already in your kitchen to easily whip up a batch in minutes, according to Commerce Editor Britt. And at a price this good, can you really afford to pass it up?2 / 20Amazon$329.95was $449.99Another kitchen staple I’ll always reccomend you score on sale when you can is a KitchenAid mixer. The great thing about it is, you don't have to be a baker to enjoy the stand mixer — it's great for mixing all kinds of recipes and can be upgraded with attachments for making everything from homemade sausages to pasta to shaved ice.3 / 20Amazon$49.99was $69.99All-Clad is an editor- and reader-favorite for a reason: This cookware lasts. While the brand is known for its stainless steel, if you’re more of a nonstick fan, you’ll love this deal. This All-Clad set includes an 8- and 10-inch frying pan that each boasts a wide surface and flared sides that make them great for everyday (and every meal) use.4 / 20Amazon$159.99was $249.00A reader favorite, this Nespresso machine is the ultimate way to elevate your morning routine. It uses centrifusion technology to brew three cup sizes for coffee, as well as both single and double espresso. With six speed settings, 19 bars of pressure, a 20-second brew time, and an Aeroccino frother, there's officially no more need for your daily coffee shop run.5 / 20Amazon$514.00was $569.99Have your heart set on picking up a Dyson before the year’s end? The Dyson V11 Origin is the way to go. It offers three cleaning modes and comes with three attachments that’ll allow you to clean your home from top to bottom, whether you need to remove pet hair from upholstery or dust from ceiling fan blades. These features, combined with its impressive motor power, will have you sold for life on Dyson vacs.6 / 20Amazon$99.95was $188.00Knife sets can get quite pricey, but this three-piece set from Zwilling is on sale on Amazon now, so you won’t have to pay more than $100 for it! The set comes with an 8” chef’s knife, as well as a 4” paring knife and a 6” utility knife, all with classic black handles that feature the brand’s logo.7 / 20Amazon$175.00was $195.00Our Place makes some of the prettiest cookware around, but the brand has also been turning out equally stunning appliances, like the Wonder Oven. It earned the approval of Mark, AT's commerce director. “I was impressed by how evenly everything cooks, and how well it performs so many different functions,” he wrote in his review. “It’s so versatile that I may never go back to using my regular oven again!”8 / 20Amazon$189.99was $249.00Apple devotees agree that the upgraded AirPods Pro are worth the splurge, thanks to upgraded features like active noise cancellation, touch sensors, and sure-fit silicone tips. And at 24% off, this is a deal worth taking advantage of.9 / 20Amazon$297.00was $399.99Tackling dry and wet messes is easy with this wet dry vacuum in your arsenal. Allowing you to vacuum and mop in one step, it works on all floor types: carpet, hardwood, laminate, tile, vinyl, marble, and stone. Plus, with its cordless design, you can rest assured any mess in any room can be handled with this bad boy.10 / 20Amazon$27.96was $39.95A solid alternative to the Stanley Quencher, Hydro Flask's All Around tumbler comes in four sizes and multiple fun colors. You get that highly coveted ergonomic handle and insulation; plus, all sizes fit most cup holders. A flexible straw and airtight lid are other notable features you'll love.11 / 20Amazon$44.99was $59.99A food chopper isn't something most people use on a daily basis, but it's good to have in case you need it for meal prep. As a result, it doesn't make a ton of sense to splurge on one. Luckily, you can buy this high-quality KitchenAid chopper right now for just $45. It's the tool you need for homemade salsa, hummus, guac, or really any liquid to semi-solid food. And it doesn't take up a ton of space.12 / 20Amazon$30.99was $45.99Not only do Mason jars just look cute, but these wide-mouthed versions are also super practical for storing all kind of eats, from pickled veggies to overnight oats. Each one has a durable glass construction and hinged airtight lid. Plus, the jars are dishwasher-safe!13 / 20Amazon$9.99was $12.99Store butter in style with this gem of a butter dish. Not only is it airtight and sure to keep the stick fresh for weeks, but it also has an anti-slip bottom to keep butter from sliding as you cut and measurement marks.14 / 20Amazon$119.00was $149.00The Gordon Ramsay-approved HexClad 10-Inch frying pan is a must-have addition to any kitchen, as it offers the perfect balance of versatility and performance. Its size is ideal for preparing meals for one or two, whether you're whipping up a quick breakfast or crafting a gourmet dinner. Designed for ultimate convenience, this pan is compatible with all cooktops — including induction — and is oven-safe up to a sizzling 500°F.15 / 20Amazon$279.99was $449.99When it comes to choosing a television that is as smart as it is stylish, nothing beats an Amazon Fire TV. This 50-inch option is currently a whopping 38% off and keeps all your favorite entertainment at your fingertips, allowing you to easily stream favorite movies, catch up on new shows, listen to music, game, and more.16 / 20Amazon$306.99was $379.95The great thing about this Vitamix blender is that it has 10 different settings, allowing you to practically choose the exact texture of your blend. It's perfect for making everything from smoothies to baby food, and the powerful blades can cut through even the toughest frozen fruits. It'll become your go-to meal prep tool in no time!17 / 20Amazon$34.99was $39.99One easy shortcut for a less hectic morning: packing your lunches for the week using leftovers from the night before. Made from high-quality borosilicate glass, these BPA-free, bento-style containers with airtight lids are just the ticket. Put your main in one part and the sides in the other compartment. 18 / 20Amazon$129.95was $319.99You’ve likely seen Staub’s iconic cocotte before — possibly in restaurant kitchens — and there’s a reason for that. The enameled cast iron on this 4-quart cocotte allows for superior heat retention and distribution. Plus, there’s no seasoning required, so you can start cooking for the whole family right out of the box.19 / 20Amazon$99.99was $139.99The Shark StainStriker spot cleaner is on major sale right now. It'll tackle all of your stains, whether they're on upholstery, the carpet, or even in your car's interior. The spot cleaner uses a dual eliminator formula that doesn't require any premixing. 20 / 20Amazon$59.99was $99.99Upgrade your cookware for 2025 in one fell swoop with this amazing deal from Carote. You'll get an 11''/9.5'' skillet, a 9.5'' saute pan, an 8''/7'' sauce pan, an 8''/9.5'' silicone lid, an 8''/7''storage lid, two handles, and four pan protectors. This set is space-saving, too, because the pan handles are detachable, and the pans are stackable.My Kitchn HelperGet our favorite editor-tested and -approved finds sent twice a week to your inbox.
html:
• Kitchen & Home
  • Life In The Kitchen

Sarah M. VazquezCommerce SEO Editor

For the past 8 years, I've covered all things shopping. My work's been published by Hearst, PureWow, and Bauer Media Group. I'm a Brooklyn-born Jersey Girl (with a BA in English from Montclair State University) who loves a good playlist, a good bagel, and my family (but not necessarily in that order).

published about 4 hours ago

We independently select these products—if you buy from one of our links, we may earn a commission. All prices were accurate at the time of publishing.

Hot take: My favorite time of the year to shop is after Christmas. Now, you might be saying to yourself, “But, what about Prime Day? Memorial Day? BLACK FRIDAY?” Yes, these sales are also great times to save big, but end-of-year sales just hit different. The discounts are still major, and once the holidays have passed, prices can drop even lower (something that makes me more than excited to whip out my shiny new gift cards). And one place I’ll always scour is Amazon. 

The Best Amazon End-of-Year Deals 

When it comes to end-of-year deals, it’s hard to top Amazon. The retail giant quite literally has it all, and thanks to its end-of-year sale, a great deal on everything from the piece of tech you’ve been eyeing to a coveted piece of cookware is practically a given. Don’t believe me? Below, I rounded up 20 of the best Amazon end-of-year deals you won’t want to miss, including a host of editor- and reader-favorites that are guaranteed to have you start off 2025 with a bang. 

1 / 20

Amazon

$169.99

was $199.99

If there’s one countertop appliance that was on everyone’s wish list this year, it was the Ninja CREAMi — and if you haven’t gotten your hands on one, now’s the time. Instead of having to run to the store every time you’re in the mood for ice cream, you can use this machine and the ingredients that are already in your kitchen to easily whip up a batch in minutes, according to Commerce Editor Britt. And at a price this good, can you really afford to pass it up?

2 / 20

Amazon

$329.95

was $449.99

Another kitchen staple I’ll always reccomend you score on sale when you can is a KitchenAid mixer. The great thing about it is, you don't have to be a baker to enjoy the stand mixer — it's great for mixing all kinds of recipes and can be upgraded with attachments for making everything from homemade sausages to pasta to shaved ice.

3 / 20

Amazon

$49.99

was $69.99

All-Clad is an editor- and reader-favorite for a reason: This cookware lasts. While the brand is known for its stainless steel, if you’re more of a nonstick fan, you’ll love this deal. This All-Clad set includes an 8- and 10-inch frying pan that each boasts a wide surface and flared sides that make them great for everyday (and every meal) use.

4 / 20

Amazon

$159.99

was $249.00

A reader favorite, this Nespresso machine is the ultimate way to elevate your morning routine. It uses centrifusion technology to brew three cup sizes for coffee, as well as both single and double espresso. With six speed settings, 19 bars of pressure, a 20-second brew time, and an Aeroccino frother, there's officially no more need for your daily coffee shop run.

5 / 20

Amazon

$514.00

was $569.99

Have your heart set on picking up a Dyson before the year’s end? The Dyson V11 Origin is the way to go. It offers three cleaning modes and comes with three attachments that’ll allow you to clean your home from top to bottom, whether you need to remove pet hair from upholstery or dust from ceiling fan blades. These features, combined with its impressive motor power, will have you sold for life on Dyson vacs.

6 / 20

Amazon

$99.95

was $188.00

Knife sets can get quite pricey, but this three-piece set from Zwilling is on sale on Amazon now, so you won’t have to pay more than $100 for it! The set comes with an 8” chef’s knife, as well as a 4” paring knife and a 6” utility knife, all with classic black handles that feature the brand’s logo.

7 / 20

Amazon

$175.00

was $195.00

Our Place makes some of the prettiest cookware around, but the brand has also been turning out equally stunning appliances, like the Wonder Oven. It earned the approval of Mark, AT's commerce director. “I was impressed by how evenly everything cooks, and how well it performs so many different functions,” he wrote in his review. “It’s so versatile that I may never go back to using my regular oven again!”

8 / 20

Amazon

$189.99

was $249.00

Apple devotees agree that the upgraded AirPods Pro are worth the splurge, thanks to upgraded features like active noise cancellation, touch sensors, and sure-fit silicone tips. And at 24% off, this is a deal worth taking advantage of.

9 / 20

Amazon

$297.00

was $399.99

Tackling dry and wet messes is easy with this wet dry vacuum in your arsenal. Allowing you to vacuum and mop in one step, it works on all floor types: carpet, hardwood, laminate, tile, vinyl, marble, and stone. Plus, with its cordless design, you can rest assured any mess in any room can be handled with this bad boy.

10 / 20

Amazon

$27.96

was $39.95

A solid alternative to the Stanley Quencher, Hydro Flask's All Around tumbler comes in four sizes and multiple fun colors. You get that highly coveted ergonomic handle and insulation; plus, all sizes fit most cup holders. A flexible straw and airtight lid are other notable features you'll love.

11 / 20

Amazon

$44.99

was $59.99

A food chopper isn't something most people use on a daily basis, but it's good to have in case you need it for meal prep. As a result, it doesn't make a ton of sense to splurge on one. Luckily, you can buy this high-quality KitchenAid chopper right now for just $45. It's the tool you need for homemade salsa, hummus, guac, or really any liquid to semi-solid food. And it doesn't take up a ton of space.

12 / 20

Amazon

$30.99

was $45.99

Not only do Mason jars just look cute, but these wide-mouthed versions are also super practical for storing all kind of eats, from pickled veggies to overnight oats. Each one has a durable glass construction and hinged airtight lid. Plus, the jars are dishwasher-safe!

13 / 20

Amazon

$9.99

was $12.99

Store butter in style with this gem of a butter dish. Not only is it airtight and sure to keep the stick fresh for weeks, but it also has an anti-slip bottom to keep butter from sliding as you cut and measurement marks.

14 / 20

Amazon

$119.00

was $149.00

The Gordon Ramsay-approved HexClad 10-Inch frying pan is a must-have addition to any kitchen, as it offers the perfect balance of versatility and performance. Its size is ideal for preparing meals for one or two, whether you're whipping up a quick breakfast or crafting a gourmet dinner. Designed for ultimate convenience, this pan is compatible with all cooktops — including induction — and is oven-safe up to a sizzling 500°F.

15 / 20

Amazon

$279.99

was $449.99

When it comes to choosing a television that is as smart as it is stylish, nothing beats an Amazon Fire TV. This 50-inch option is currently a whopping 38% off and keeps all your favorite entertainment at your fingertips, allowing you to easily stream favorite movies, catch up on new shows, listen to music, game, and more.

16 / 20

Amazon

$306.99

was $379.95

The great thing about this Vitamix blender is that it has 10 different settings, allowing you to practically choose the exact texture of your blend. It's perfect for making everything from smoothies to baby food, and the powerful blades can cut through even the toughest frozen fruits. It'll become your go-to meal prep tool in no time!

17 / 20

Amazon

$34.99

was $39.99

One easy shortcut for a less hectic morning: packing your lunches for the week using leftovers from the night before. Made from high-quality borosilicate glass, these BPA-free, bento-style containers with airtight lids are just the ticket. Put your main in one part and the sides in the other compartment.

18 / 20

Amazon

$129.95

was $319.99

You’ve likely seen Staub’s iconic cocotte before — possibly in restaurant kitchens — and there’s a reason for that. The enameled cast iron on this 4-quart cocotte allows for superior heat retention and distribution. Plus, there’s no seasoning required, so you can start cooking for the whole family right out of the box.

19 / 20

Amazon

$99.99

was $139.99

The Shark StainStriker spot cleaner is on major sale right now. It'll tackle all of your stains, whether they're on upholstery, the carpet, or even in your car's interior. The spot cleaner uses a dual eliminator formula that doesn't require any premixing.

20 / 20

Amazon

$59.99

was $99.99

Upgrade your cookware for 2025 in one fell swoop with this amazing deal from Carote. You'll get an 11''/9.5'' skillet, a 9.5'' saute pan, an 8''/7'' sauce pan, an 8''/9.5'' silicone lid, an 8''/7''storage lid, two handles, and four pan protectors. This set is space-saving, too, because the pan handles are detachable, and the pans are stackable.
